extendedInfo.description: Conflicts: D-Day is a highly rated turn based strategy game which takes place on the Western Front during the Second World War. General Eisenhower has stepped down and you are in the command of the Allied invasion force - tank, airborne, infantry and air force units - and the object of the game is to break out from the D-Day beachheads and liberate as much of Nazi-occupied France as possible, as quickly as possible. To have a chance to seize the top spot in the Hall of Fame you need to skillfully encircle German units commanded by Erwin Rommel, while battling both the regular Wehrmacht divisions and the feared Panzer VI (Tiger I) tank units.FEATURES:+ Long-lasting: Thanks to in-built variation and the game's smart AI technology, each game provides a unique war gaming experience.+ Competitive: Measure your strategy game skills against others fighting for the Hall of Fame top spots.+ Supports casual play: Easy to pick up, leave off, continue later.+ Challenging: Crush your enemy quickly and earn the bragging rights on the forum.+ Settings: Various settings to alter the look of the gaming experience: difficulty levels, what to draw on the map, custom font and map size.+ Experienced units learn new skills, like improved attack or defence performance, ability to cross rivers without losing extra move points.+ A wide variety of units under your command: Sherman M4 tanks, American/British/Canadian infantry divisions, paratroopers, special units like US Army Rangers and Royal Marines Commando Brigade, Crab mine cleaner tanks and air force units. Meanwhile, the German Wehrmacht starts with coastal fortifications, and weaker ost battalions and static infantry units, but as the days pass, is reinforced with regular infantry, Waffen SS and Panzer divisions.+ Historical accuracy: Campaign mirrors the historical setup of the real 1944 Normandy landings - including the divisions that saw combat during the D-Day and the following Normandy Campaign in World War II.+ Tablet friendly strategy game: Automatically scales the map for any physical screen size/resolution from small smartphones to HD tablets, while settings allow you to fine tune hexagon and font sizes.In order to be a victorious general, it is essential that you learn to coordinate your attacks in two ways. First, as adjacent units give support to an attacking unit, keep your units in groups in order to gain local superiority. Secondly, it is rarely the best idea to use brute force when it is possible to encircle the enemy and cut off its supply lines instead.To get a sense of how Conflicts: D-Day works, try out Operation Barbarossa LITE -- http://bit.ly/GVaC8a -- which uses the same mechanics as Conflicts: D-Day.Answer the call of duty and join Conflict series on Facebook or Google Plus!+ http://on.fb.me/wsC2QV (FB)+ http://bit.ly/GHHGU1 (G+)Join your fellow strategy gamers in turning the tide of the Second World War!The list below includes the permissions requested and the reasons for their use.+ Internet: To fetch Hall of Fame data from a server.+ Network State: To determine whether or not you are connected to the internet so the game doesn't crash while trying to connect.+ Control Vibrator: To vibrate the phone during the battles (visit settings to turn the feature OFF or alter its behaviour).

reviews.title: Well worth the money
reviews.comment: I must have 5 of these titles, they remind me of the old Spectrum 128 games I played in my youth. Love them, proper wargames.
reviews.author: Matthew Winter

reviews.title: Top Dog in Strategy
reviews.comment: I have most of this designer\'s titles and can easily recommmend all. I don\'t have any qualms about buying  multiple titles to play opposing sides, I am happy to support. Considering the huge amount of money that I\'ve spent previously searching for solid gameplay, these games are a fantastic bargain and well worth any strategist\'s efforts. S&T, Wargamer, and Command fans take notice. Look forward to any future endeavours, hopefully some earlier historical periods where combat was really dicey. 100 Years War, Crusades, Mongol expansion, the Armadas, Charlemagne, et al. These are the way to a commander\'s heart. Kind regards
reviews.author: David Maynard

reviews.title: Excellant
reviews.comment: DD is my sixth Conflicts game.  I have not been disappointed, yet.  All of Mr. Nuutinen\'s games are exceptional value for your money.
reviews.author: John Parrish

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: - It took days to finish my first game. It reminds me of an old Commodore 64 game (circa 1986) same genre. Love it !!!!!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: 5 Words
reviews.comment: Great game Now Pacific theatre.
reviews.author: Brent M.

reviews.title: Must-play!
reviews.comment: Challenging, educational, and entertaining!  Joni\'s games are brilliant, and his product support is exceptional!!!
reviews.author: Chip Stockton

reviews.title: Fantastic turn based strategy game
reviews.comment: Exactly what I was looking for in a turn based strategy game. Easy to learn, fun and challenging to play. Kudos!
reviews.author: Michael Vogt

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment: Mapboard needs more color, look at the avolon hill board for this game. Great AI
reviews.author: Mike Moore

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: Took me a long time to get into the hall of fame. Definitely a long lasting game. Worth every penny
reviews.author: kyle morrrison

reviews.title: Old School Gaming
reviews.comment: The old school way to play on the phone. Works great, love playing them.
reviews.author: Tony K.

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Great  turn based strategy game. Reminds me of RISK. Worth downloading for sure.
reviews.author: Graham Lord

reviews.title: Weird Gameplay
reviews.comment: Maybe I misunderstand the gameplay mechanics, but one thing I\'ve consistently noticed is that enemy units that are defeated will sometimes fallback or withdraw to the rear of my own unit. It feels really gamey, chasing down units that have 1 or 2 HP left. Whereas, they should be fallback to their rear lines. And the game is very ugly.
reviews.author: Michael Patti

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: Proper old school turn based strategy game like I grew up with. Brilliant.
reviews.author: Nigel Doughty

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: Beautifully balanced engine.
reviews.author: Adrian Bates

reviews.title: Easy mode?
reviews.comment: I put the game in easy mode, expecting to come across unicorns and kittens. Nope. Just a wall of enemies bearing down on my army. Developer has no sense of \'easy\' mode. Well, I guess it IS easy if you\'re already an experienced player.
reviews.author: Andrew Tuline

reviews.title: Too expensive
reviews.comment: Panzer missions goes on forever and it\'s basically the same game. This version sure has a few extras but it\'s a single map. Not good value
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nearly Perfect
reviews.comment: WHERE IS FALL OF NORMANDY?????  I grew up playing those great Avalon Hill board games, esp Squad Leader, et al. This is that platform for droid. Classic. How bout naval game next?;)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Took me four beautiful long evenings to complete. During that time my dog never got walked my daughter had little contact with her father my partner threatened to leave me and my work was severely affected by my addiction to this game at 2am. Now its time for operation barbarossa, and perhaps the single life. How about artillery from sea and land? Ability to drop paras a little beyond enemy lines? Perhaps attaching them to an airbase?Not criticising just ideas. Love it all. Amazing game.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Great game go back to it time and again.
reviews.author: John Bauckham

reviews.title: Yay
reviews.comment: Great game.
reviews.author: A Google User
